subject: Calibration Settings Not Saving – Simsonn Plus X Pedals
description_text:
Hello Simsonn Support,

I recently purchased a set of *Simsonn Plus X pedals* and I am experiencing
issues with calibration using *Simsonn Manager 2.1*.

   -

   CPU1 firmware: v2.0.2
   -

   CPU2 firmware: v2.0.0

The problem I’m facing:

   -

   After completing calibration, when I set values such as *elastomers,
   maximum force, or deadzones*, they reset every time I click *Save*.
   -

   The values are not written to the pedals, so in iRacing the game still
   expects the original calibration (around 45 kg brake force), even if I set
   maximum force to 20 kg.
   -

   Deadzones are also not being applied.

I have tried the following without success:

   -

   Running Simsonn Manager as Administrator
   -

   Using different USB ports (directly on the motherboard)
   -

   Reinstalling Simsonn Manager

Could you please advise me on how to resolve this issue? Should both CPUs
be updated to the same firmware version, or is there another step I am
missing to ensure that calibration values are saved correctly?

Thank you for your assistance,
Cosmin

conversations.body_text: I would like to add some additional details regarding my troubleshooting attempts:    I also tested with Simsonn Manager 2.0.9, but the issue is the same — calibration values (elastomers, maximum force, deadzones) reset after saving and are not applied to the pedals.    I tried using SimPedalsConfig V3.5, V4, and FreeJoy, but in all cases the pedals are not recognized by the software at all.

Hi Cosmin Stefanescu,     Please uninstall the old version of the software from your PC and install the new 2.1.1 version from the link.  Also, please note that iRacing requires an additional re-calibration, as it does not automatically apply the preset values of the pedals, which is a particular characteristic of this game.      https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BAdSWa1bxmbPksj9Hlzuo8bl7_bM8ixr/view?usp=drivesdk
